title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON – On a night where offense was a premium, one man refused to let his team lose.

In a defensive slugfest at the old Boston Garden, the Celtics clawed out a 96-91 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks, but the final score was merely a footnote to a legendary individual performance. This was the Antoine Walker game.

Walker, the Celtics' dynamic forward, authored a historic masterpiece, pouring in a career-high and game-dominant 49 points. In a contest where no other player on either team could crack 20 points, Walker was an unstoppable force, single-handedly outscoring the entire Bucks starting lineup for long stretches of the game. His breathtaking output, coming on a night the team needed every last one of them, was the sole reason the Celtics emerged victorious.

The Bucks, led by Terrell Brandon’s 17 points and 10 assists, fought valiantly. They bottled up every other Celtic, holding the rest of the roster to a collective 47 points on frigid shooting. But there was no answer for Walker. He attacked from every angle, a one-man offensive system against a formidable Milwaukee defense.

In the game's crucial final minutes, with the score teetering, it was inevitably Walker who rose to the occasion. He drained the decisive baskets, silencing the Bucks' rally and sealing the win with his final, exclamation-point free throws.

While the box score will show a narrow five-point win for Boston, the true story was written by one man. On this night, Antoine Walker didn't just beat the Milwaukee Bucks; he carried his team to victory on his back, delivering a 49-point performance for the ages.
